vulnerabilities.title: expr-eval does not restrict functions passed to the evaluate function
vulnerabilities.description: The expr-eval library is a JavaScript expression parser and evaluator designed to safely evaluate mathematical expressions with user-defined variables. However, due to insufficient input validation, an attacker can pass a crafted variables object into the evaluate() function and trigger arbitrary code execution.

vulnerabilities.title: expr-eval vulnerable to Prototype Pollution
vulnerabilities.description: npm package `expr-eval` is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. An attacker with access to express eval interface can use JavaScript prototype-based inheritance model to achieve arbitrary code execution. The npm expr-eval-fork package resolves this issue.
